title: Philip Morris International (golf)
text:
The Philip Morris International was a professional team <a href="golf">golf</a> tournament, played from 1972 and 1976. The 1972 and 1973 tournaments were called the Marlboro Nations' Cup. There was no tournament in 1974 but the event was played in 1975 and 1976 under a different name. All events were played in <a href="France">France</a>. The tournament had a knock-out format with up to 16 teams competing. There were two players in each team, each match consisting of a foursomes followed by two singles matches.
The 1972 event was played at <a href="Mandelieu-la-Napoule">Mandelieu-la-Napoule</a> near <a href="Cannes">Cannes</a>, the 1973 and 1975 events were played at <a href="Hardelot">Hardelot</a> near <a href="Boulogne">Boulogne</a> in northern France. In 1976 it was played at <a href="Divonne-les-Bains">Divonne-les-Bains</a> on the Swiss border near <a href="Geneva">Geneva</a>.
In 1972 and 1973 all the team were European, with the exception of Morocco who competed in 1972. Australia and South Africa competed in 1975 and they were joined by the United States, Argentina and New Zealand in 1976.
1972.
